snapshot.name: Michael Chen
snapshot.teaser: 41-year-old office worker with 6-week history of neck pain radiating to right upper extremity with numbness in thumb/index

history.chief_complaint: Neck pain radiating to right arm with numbness/tingling
history.hpi: Insidious onset 6 weeks ago after prolonged laptop work and poor ergonomics. Pain in right lateral neck/upper trapezius radiating to lateral arm/forearm with numbness in thumb and index finger. Worsened by prolonged sitting and cervical extension/rotation to the right. Relief with unloading and slight cervical flexion.
history.mechanism_of_injury: Cumulative postural strain from prolonged forward head posture and laptop use

pain.location: Right lateral neck/upper trapezius with radiation to lateral arm/forearm
pain.quality: Aching neck pain with sharp radiating pain; paresthesia in thumb/index
pain.aggravating_factors: Prolonged sitting, looking up, right rotation, carrying briefcase on right
pain.easing_factors: Unloading, arm supported, supine with slight flexion, short rest breaks

pmh: Mild episodic neck strain in past
functional_goals: Return to gym resistance training without arm pain

eval.notes_seed: Subacute C6 radiculopathy pattern with postural intolerance

subjective.chiefComplaint: Neck pain with right arm radiculopathy
subjective.historyOfPresentIllness: 41-year-old office worker with 6-week history of neck pain radiating to right arm, numbness in thumb/index, aggravated by sitting and extension/rotation.
subjective.painLocation: Right lateral neck/upper trapezius with radiation to lateral arm/forearm
subjective.painQuality: Aching neck pain with sharp radiating pain; paresthesia in thumb/index
subjective.aggravatingFactors: Prolonged sitting, looking up, right rotation, carrying briefcase on right
subjective.easingFactors: Unloading, arm supported, supine with slight flexion, short rest breaks
subjective.functionalLimitations: Can only sit 20–30 minutes before symptoms; difficulty sleeping due to arm pain/paresthesia; avoids looking up
subjective.priorLevel: Independent with desk work and gym workouts
subjective.patientGoals: Work full day without arm pain; resume gym without symptoms; sleep through night
subjective.redFlags: No fever, cancer history, progressive neuro deficit, or myelopathic signs
subjective.additionalHistory: Right-hand dominant; no trauma; ergonomic workstation suboptimal (laptop on dining table)

objective.text: Vitals stable. Forward head/rounded shoulders posture. Guarded right rotation.

inspection.visual: Postural asymmetry: protracted shoulders, forward head, mild upper thoracic kyphosis.

palpation.findings: Tender right levator scapulae/upper trapezius; segmental stiffness C5–C7.

neuro.screening: Right C6 sensory decrease (thumb/index); diminished biceps reflex on right (1+); weakness with wrist extension (4+/5) due to pain inhibition.

functional.assessment: NDI 28/100; peripheralization with extension/right quadrant; relief with slightly flexed posture; positive ULTT A (median) on right.

assessment.primaryImpairments: Cervical radiculopathy signs consistent with C6 nerve root irritation: sensory changes in thumb/index, decreased biceps reflex, painful weakness wrist extensors; postural dysfunction and segmental hypomobility C5–C7.
assessment.bodyFunctions: Impaired neural mechanosensitivity (median nerve), reduced cervical ROM with pain, segmental stiffness, muscular tenderness.
assessment.activityLimitations: Sitting tolerance limited to 20–30 minutes; difficulty sleeping; avoidance of extension/looking up.
assessment.participationRestrictions: Reduced work productivity, stopped gym program due to symptoms.
assessment.prognosticFactors: Favorable response to unloading; short-to-moderate duration; motivated; no red flags.
assessment.clinicalReasoning: Symptom distribution, neuro findings (sensory/reflex/strength), and provocative/relief patterns indicate C6 radiculopathy likely from foraminal stenosis/disc-osteophyte complex. Conservative care indicated: education, posture/ergonomics, directional preference unloading, graded mobility and neural mobilization, progressive conditioning.

plan.treatmentPlan: Education/ergonomics, cervical/thoracic mobilization, traction trials, neural mobilization (median nerve sliders), deep neck flexor/Scap re-ed, progressive postural endurance; activity pacing.
plan.patientEducation: Laptop riser, external keyboard/mouse; sit breaks q30–45 min; avoid sustained extension/right rotation; supported sleep; symptom monitoring and pacing.

goal_1.goalText: Increase sitting tolerance to ≥60 minutes without arm pain within 3–4 weeks.

goal_2.goalText: Reduce worst pain to ≤3/10 and paresthesia frequency by ≥50% within 4 weeks.

goal_3.goalText: NDI improve from 28/100 to ≤14/100 within 6 weeks.

goal_4.goalText: Resume gym resistance training (upper body) at 70–80% prior loads without symptoms by 6 weeks.

ex_1.exerciseText: Chin tucks (DNF activation) — 3x10, daily; progress holds to 10s.

ex_3.exerciseText: Scapular retraction + depression with band — 3x12, EOD.

ex_4.exerciseText: Thoracic extension mobilization over foam roller — 2–3 min, daily.

ex_5.exerciseText: Postural endurance circuit: prone Y/T/W and rows — 2–3 sets, EOD.

ordersReferrals.details: Consider MRI if no meaningful improvement by 6–8 weeks or progressive neuro deficits.
